title: The Phantom Warning
excerpt: I was drifting through town, lost in thought, when I saw her. A woman in Victorian dress stood at the corner, her eyes fixed on me...
fullText: I was drifting through town, lost in thought, when I saw her. A woman in Victorian dress stood at the corner, her eyes fixed on me. She raised her hand and pointed down the street. I felt a chill run down my spine. When I blinked, she was gone. Minutes later, I heard sirens—a car had crashed at the exact spot where she had pointed.

title: Whispers in the Library
excerpt: Late one night while studying in the old library, I heard whispering coming from the restricted section. No one else was there...
fullText: Late one night while studying in the old library, I heard whispering coming from the restricted section. No one else was there. The whispers grew louder, speaking in a language I didn't recognize. I gathered my things and left immediately. The next day, I learned the restricted section was sealed off decades ago after a fire.

title: The Shadow Figure
excerpt: Walking home from work, I noticed a dark shadow following me. It had no clear form, just a darkness that moved...
fullText: Walking home from work, I noticed a dark shadow following me. It had no clear form, just a darkness that moved independently of the streetlights. I quickened my pace, but it kept up effortlessly. When I reached my flat and turned around, it simply dissipated into the evening air.

title: The Crying Child
excerpt: I awoke to the sound of a child crying in the hallway. I checked on my own children—both fast asleep...
fullText: I awoke to the sound of a child crying in the hallway. I checked on my own children—both fast asleep. I searched the entire house but found nothing. The crying continued for hours, always just out of sight. The next morning, my neighbor mentioned her grandson had died in a car accident 30 years ago on that exact date.

title: The Vanishing Hitchhiker
excerpt: I picked up a hitchhiker on a lonely country road. She was soaking wet despite no rain in sight...
fullText: I picked up a hitchhiker on a lonely country road. She was soaking wet despite no rain in sight. She gave me an address and sat silently throughout the journey. When I arrived and turned to ask for directions to her door, the passenger seat was empty. Her soaked jacket was still there.

title: Footsteps in the Attic
excerpt: Every night at 2 AM, I hear footsteps pacing back and forth in the attic above my bedroom...
fullText: Every night at 2 AM, I hear footsteps pacing back and forth in the attic above my bedroom. The footsteps are heavy and deliberate. When I investigated the attic, I found old journals belonging to the previous owner. He had died in that very attic under mysterious circumstances.

title: The Cold Spot
excerpt: In my Victorian home, there's a corner of the living room that is always ice cold, even in summer...
fullText: In my Victorian home, there's a corner of the living room that is always ice cold, even in summer. Pets refuse to enter that area. One evening, I saw a translucent figure standing in that exact spot. It looked at me for a moment before fading away. A week later, I discovered this was where a servant had died in a fire over 100 years ago.

title: The Mirror's Reflection
excerpt: I noticed something strange—my reflection in the mirror moved slightly slower than I did...
fullText: I noticed something strange—my reflection in the mirror moved slightly slower than I did. At first, I thought it was a trick of the light. But one night, my reflection smiled at me while I remained expressionless. I removed that mirror from my home immediately.
